MODULE.name: ORMModel
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The ORM Model provides CRUD and helper methods for your defined model to interact with the database. You must define and add a model before you can use the ORM Model Object. See Orm to learn about defining and adding a model.
MODULE.MORE_HELP: See remarks for different between ruby and javascript usage.

PROPERTY.name: metadata
PROPERTY.DESC: Returns the metadata definition for a given model as a hash. Click here for a Orm metadata example. Assigns the hash metadata definition for a given model. Click here for a Orm metadata example.

METHOD.name: clearNotification
METHOD.DESC: Clear notification for the object. See the sync notification section for more details.

METHOD.name: deleteAll
METHOD.DESC: Delete all Rhodes model objects for a source, filtering by conditions. Click here for a Orm delete_all example.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: hash of attribute/values; delete only objects matching these criteria, such as :conditions => {'industry'=>'electronics'}.

PARAM.name: op
PARAM.DESC: (optional) operator, such as "OR" or "IN". Allows you to have more than one set of conditions.

METHOD.name: destroy
METHOD.DESC: Destroy a Rhodes model object. Click here for a Orm destroy example.

METHOD.name: find
METHOD.DESC: Find Rhodes model objects. Click here for a Orm find example. For examples of find with advanced queries, see Advanced Queries in Using the Local Database with Orm.

VALUE.DESC: returns all objects; can use optional :conditions.
returns the number of objects matching these :conditions.

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: Hash of attribute/values. Also supports sql fragments (i.e. "name like 'Ormobile'") or sql fragment with binding (you have to define :select with sql queries) (i.e. ["name like ?", "'#{company#}'"]) Use a comma around string values.

PARAM.name: order
PARAM.DESC: Attribute(s) to order the list.

PARAM.name: orderdir
PARAM.DESC: Order direction: 'ASC' ascending, 'DESC' descending. Default = 'ASC'.)

PARAM.name: select
PARAM.DESC: Array of string attributes to return with the object. Useful if your model has many attributes and your query only needs a few of them.

PARAM.name: perPage
PARAM.DESC: Maximum number of items to return.

PARAM.name: offset
PARAM.DESC: Offset from beginning of the list.

PARAM.name: op
PARAM.DESC: (optional) operator, such as "OR" or "IN". Allows you to have more than one set of conditions.

METHOD.name: findBySql
METHOD.DESC: Returns Rhodes model object(s) based on sql_query. This method works only for schema models. Click here for a Orm find_by_sql example.

PARAM.name: query
PARAM.DESC: An sql query, such as "SELECT * FROM Account".

METHOD.name: getSourceName
METHOD.DESC: Returns the source name for this Rhodes model object.

METHOD.name: new
METHOD.DESC: Create a new Rhodes model object. Orm new example.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes assigned to the new model object, such as {"name" => "ABC Inc.","address" => "555 5th St."}.

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Create a new Rhodes model object and save it to the database.Orm create example. This is the fastest way to insert a single item into the database.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes assigned to the new model object, such as {"name" => "ABC Inc.","address" => "555 5th St."}.

METHOD.name: paginate
METHOD.DESC: Call find with a limit on the number of records. Default page size is 10. Orm paginate example.

PARAM.name: page
PARAM.DESC: which page to return.

PARAM.name: perPage
PARAM.DESC: with :page (used as offset), the number of records to return, such as :page => 1, :per_page => 20

PARAM.name: conditions
PARAM.DESC: same as find with :conditions

PARAM.name: order
PARAM.DESC: same as find with :conditions

PARAM.name: select
PARAM.DESC: same as find with :select

METHOD.name: sync
METHOD.DESC: Start the sync process for a Rhodes model. Click here for a Orm sync example.

PARAM.name: callbackUrl
PARAM.DESC: the url for the sync callback method. If this is used, SyncEngine.set_notification is called before SyncEngine.dosync.

PARAM.name: callbackData
PARAM.DESC: Data for the callback method.

PARAM.name: showStatusPopup
PARAM.DESC: true if you want to show a popup window upon sync, false otherwise.

PARAM.name: queryParams
PARAM.DESC: query to pass to the sync server. The query_params value must be URL encoded.

METHOD.name: isChanged
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if a Rhodes model object has local database changes that need to be synchronized, false otherwise. Click here for a Orm changed? example.

METHOD.name: setNotification
METHOD.DESC: Saves the current Rhodes model object to the database. Click here for a Orm save example.

PARAM.name: callbackUrl
PARAM.DESC: the url for your sync is finished notification callback method.

PARAM.name: params
PARAM.DESC: parameters for the callback method.

METHOD.name: destroy
METHOD.DESC: Destroy a Rhodes model object. Click here for a ORM destroy example.

METHOD.name: canModify
METHOD.DESC: Returns true if the Rhodes model object is not currently being synced (if it is being synced, you should disable editing of the object). Click here for a ORM can_modify example. Before displaying an edit page for an object, your application can check if the object is currently being accessed by the sync process. If it is, you should disable editing of the object. can_modify could return true, for example, on a new local record that was created and sent to the RhoConnect application, but no response has been received yet.

METHOD.name: save
METHOD.DESC: Saves the current Rhodes model object to the database. Click here for a ORM save example.

METHOD.name: updateAttributes
METHOD.DESC: Updates the current Rho model object attributes and saves it to the database. This is the fastest way to add or update model attributes. Click here for a ORM update_attributes example.

PARAM.name: attributes
PARAM.DESC: List of attributes and their updated values, such as {"name" => "ABC Inc.","address" => "555 5th St."}.

SECTION.DESC: Delete all Rhodes model objects for a source, filtering by conditions.
Find all objects for specific ORM model
Find all objects for specific ORM model with conditions
Use select option for retrieves some attributes of object

CODE.RUBY: accounts = Account.find(:all, :select => ['name','address']) accounts[0].name #=> "A.G. Parr PLC 37862" accounts[0].telephone #=> nil

SECTION.DESC:
Order option is used to sort objects by one or more attributes. The order argument for find accepts several fORMs.
Order by one attribute.
Order by multiple attributes.
Order by one attribute with a block.

CODE.RUBY: accounts = Account.find(:all, :order => 'name') do |x,y| y <=> x end

SECTION.DESC: Order with a block.

CODE.RUBY: accounts = Account.find(:all) do |item1,item2| item2.name <=> item1.name end

EXAMPLE.title: ORM New and Create Method Examples

SECTION.DESC: Use method New for creating a new ORM object and assign given attributes.

CODE.RUBY: account = Account.new({"name" => "ABC Inc.", "address" => "555 5th St."}) account.name #=> "ABC Inc."
CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var account = Account.new({name: "ABC Inc.", address: "555 5th St."}); account.name // "ABC Inc."

SECTION.DESC: Use method Create for creating a new ORM object and save to the database.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var account = Account.create({name: "some new record", industry: "electronics"})

Set a notification to be called when the sync is complete for this model. This is useful for example if you want to refresh the current list page or display an alert when new data is synchronized. See the sync notification docs for more infORMation.
Determine if a ORM model has local database changes that need to be synchronized.

CODE.RUBY: def should_sync_product_object if Product.isChanged #... do stuff ... end end

Update the current ORM object’s attributes and saves it to the database.

CODE.RUBY:
account = Account.find( :first, :conditions => {'name' => 'ABC Inc.'} ) account.update_attributes({"name" => "ABC Inc.", "industry" => "Technology"})
account.industry #=> "Technology"

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: var account = Account.new({name: "some new record", industry: "electronics"}); account.save();

SECTION.DESC: Before displaying an edit page for an object, your application can check if the object is currently being accessed by the sync process. If it is, you should disable editing of the object. canModify could return true, for example, on a new local record that was created and sent to the RhoConnect application, but no response has been received yet.

CODE.RUBY: def edit @product = Product.find(@params['id']) if @product && !@product.can_modify render :action => :show_edit_error else render :action => :edit end end
